sentences.english: Mothers-in-law hasten sons-in-law to buy houses, thus they may assure before their daughters getting married.
sentences.chinese: 丈母孃督促小女婿快點買房，這樣才放心嫁女兒。

sentences.english: I need one, and your sons-in-law can dig new clay for Susana.
sentences.chinese: 我需要一把鍬，你的女婿可以幫蘇姍娜挖新的黏土。

sentences.english: "My daughter and son-in-law were there, " he said.
She was assisted in the management of her vast property by her son-in-law Mathur Mohan.
sentences.chinese: 她被女婿馬圖爾巴烏任命去協助管理巨大的財富。

sentences.english: My father is happy to have a son-in-law such as Robin.
sentences.chinese: 父親對魯賓這樣的女婿還是比較滿意的。

sentences.english: I really want to get to know my grandson and my son-in-law.
sentences.chinese: 我真的很想認識下我的外孫和女婿。

sentences.english: Be attentive to the daughter or son in law.
His voice and his twinkly smile were an affectionate compliment to his daughter-in-law.
sentences.chinese: 他的聲音和他是一個微笑着深情讚美他的女兒女婿。

sentences.english: Perhaps if their son-in-law were rich, they might have taken a little more interest in their daughter.
sentences.chinese: 假如女婿闊得很，也許他們對柔嘉的興趣會增加些。

sentences.english: his nephew and son-in-law Yahia Saleh, who heads the security forces.
sentences.chinese: 他的侄子和女婿是安全部隊的領導。

sentences.english: The shrine is believed by many to be the tomb of the Prophet Muhammad's son-in-law.
sentences.chinese: 很多人都相信這座清真寺是先知穆罕默德女婿的陵墓。

sentences.english: She accuses her sister-in-law of being too present in the media.
sentences.chinese: 她指責媒體過於目前在她的妹妹女婿。
我女兒非常聰明能幹，但是嫁了個沒頭腦的女婿。

sentences.english: It is usually husbands who crack the jokes about difficult, interfering mothers-in-law .
sentences.chinese: 女婿們常愛拿難纏多事的丈母孃開開玩笑。

sentences.english: Her son-in-law, Mark Jameson, works in Hoboken and said he saw the plane outside his window.
sentences.chinese: 她的女婿，馬克詹姆遜說，他看到窗口以外的飛機。

sentences.english: Mrs. Welland enquired as she shook hands with her future son- in-law.
sentences.chinese: 韋蘭太太與她未來的女婿握手時問道。

definition: parents of one's daughter-in-law or son-in-law/relatives by marriage
daughter's son/grandson/descendant via the female line

Sun Tzu, also known as Sun Wu 孫武|孙武[Sun1 Wu3] (c. 500 BC, dates of birth and death uncertain), general, strategist and philosopher of the Spring and Autumn Period (700-475 BC), believed to be the author of the “Art of War” 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3], one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1]
erhua variant of 兒媳婦|儿媳妇[er2 xi2 fu5]
